text: but from the vs code extension it asks
you which browsers you want to install
and you just select the browsers
playwright will then install those

to have these browsers like on your

um you've now got these browsers and
playwright will run the tests on all

want to run them on
um so if you're having problems on let's
just say Safari because you know
sometimes people have problems with
Safari
um that means that when you go to
production without having to do any
extra work your test is going to run
across all those browsers and you're
going to find those Safari bugs before

able to fix it it could be a tiny little
CSS issue normally as a CSS issue and
then you fix that and it's going to work
